_header: I will bewail in manner of tragedy
Title(s): Monk’s Tale; ‘De Casibus Virorum Illustrium’; Canterbury Tales
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Monk’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 776 lines in eight-line stanzas.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
I wol bewaile in manere of Tregediethe harme of hem that stode in
                    high degre…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…that hight Daunte for he can hit devisefro poynte to poynte
                    not oo worde wol he fayle

BodBar20.First Lines:
I wole bewaile in manere of tragedieþe harme of hem þat
                    stondith in hyȝ degre…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…ffor when men trusteþ hir þan wole she faileAnd
                    kouer hir bright face with a cloude
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here bygynnythe þe prologe [sic] (f.
                    233v); Here endith þe monkes… (f. 245)

Bod414.First Lines:
[I] Will bewaile in maner of TragedyThe harme of hem þat stode
                    in hiȝ degre…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…ffor whan men trusten hir þen wil she faileAnd couer hir
                    bright face with a cloude
Bod414.Note:
VII.2130 omitted; spurious lines follow 2131, 2339; 2155 inserted in
                    margin.

BodHatDon1.First Lines:

                    in hie degre…

                    hir bright face with a cloude

                    her bright face wiþ a cloude
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:

                    258)

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
I wyll be weyle in maner of tragedyeThe harme of hem that stondeth
                    in hye degre…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…ffor when men trusteth hur then wol she fayleAnd keuere hur
                    bryght face with a clowde
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title: …Here begynneth the Monkes tale (f. 116); The Monke (RT)

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
I wil bewaile in maner of a tregedrithe harme of hem that stonde in
                    degre hihe…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…He slowe the geant Antheus the strongeHe slowe the griseli
                    bore and that anon…
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title:
here begynneth the monkes tale (f. 115); fab (f. 115,
                    margin)

                    in heigh degre…

                        standeþ
stoden in heih degre…

OxfNew314.First Lines:
I wil be waile in manere of tregedieThe harm of hem þat
                    stonden in hiȝ degre…
OxfNew314.Last Lines:

                    briȝt face vnder a cloude

                    the monkes tale (f. 249)

CULGg427.First Lines:
I Wole be wayle in manere of TragedieThe harm of hem that stood in
                    hey degre…

                    was to been brought…

CULGg427.Attributed Title: Here begynnyth the Monk his tale (f. 352, rubric)

CamTCC595.First Lines:
I wille bewayle on maner of tregedieThe harme of hem that stovden
                    in hie degre…
CamTCC595.Last Lines:
…ffor when men truste in hir than wol she failleAnd covir hir
                    bright face vndir a cloude
CamTCC595.Note:

CamTCC599.First Lines:
[I] Wyll bewayle lin maner of tragedyThe harme of theym that
                    stondyn in hygh degre…
[T]How noble Sampson whiche was annunciatBy the Aungell long or hys
                    natyuyte…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…Now art thow sathanas that mayst nat twynOut of mysery whyche
                    thow art in fall
…ffor when men trust in hyr then woll she faylleAnd couer hyr
                    bryght face vndyr a cloude
CamTCC599.Attributed Title:
Explicit Prohemyum (f. 170v); The tragedy of Sampson (f.
                    179); Explicit (f. 188)

HunEL26C9.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Ellesmere Manuscript of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales.
Chaucer Society
         Series 1, nos. 2, 8, 16, 26, 32, 38, 50, 70. London: Trübner,
            1868-79.

HunHM144.First Lines:
I wil biwaile in maner of de tragedeThe harme of hem
                    þat stond in heigh degre…
HunHM144.Last Lines:
…ffor when men trustith her than wyl she fayleAnd couer her
                    bright face with a cloude
HunHM144.Attributed Title:
They that this present & forseyde tale / haue or shal Reede Remembyr
                    the no / ble prouerbis that rebukyth Couetise and Vengeaunce takyng in truste of
                    / ffortune whiche hathe causyd many / a noble Prince to falle as we may rede /
                    of them here folluyng (f. 99v, following the extracted
                    Meilbee); The Falle Of Princis (RT)
HunHM144.Facsimiles:
Digital
                    Scriptorium: Huntington Library MS HM 144.
         Columbia University, 1996-.

BNangl39.First Lines:
I wil bewaylen in maner of tregedyethe harme of hem that stood in
                    hy degree…
BNangl39.Last Lines:
…but to his wyfe toild he his secreethurgh which he slough
                    hymself in wrechidnesse
BNangl39.Attributed Title:
Hic incpit fabula Monachi (f. 73va); Non plus de ista
                        fabula quia est valde dolorosa… (f. 73va)

TokyoTak24.First Lines:
I wol bewaile in maner of TragedieThe harme of hem that stonden in
                    high degre…
TokyoTak24.Last Lines:
…That hiȝt Daunt for he can it wel deuiseffrom point to
                    point nat oo word wol he faill
TokyoTak24.Attributed Title:
…Et incipit fabula sua de casibus / virorum illustrium (f.
                    194); Monkes tale (RT); Hiere endith the Monkes tale… (f. 205)

TokyoTak32.First Lines:
I wole by wayle in thee manere of tregedyeThee harme of hym that
                    standyht in hey degre…
TokyoTak32.Last Lines:
…Withinne his presone hee made thee to deyeBut why no how note
                    I that thow were slawe
TokyoTak32.Note:
VII.2407-766 omitted (eight lines left blank following 2406); spurious
                    line follows 2369.
TokyoTak32.Attributed Title:
Here bee gynnyht thee tale (f. 122ra); Thee Mvnkis tale
                    (RT)

Bodmer48.First Lines:
I wil bewail in maner of Tregedyeþe harm of hem þat stode
                    in hye degre…
Bodmer48.Last Lines:
…for when men trust hir þen wil she failAnd couer hir
                    bright face with a cloude
Bodmer48.Attributed Title: The Tale of the Monk (f. 190, rubric)
